name: Svið
short_description: Singed and halved, sheep's head is cooked to perfection in Icelandic tradition, showcasing a bold flavor profile. Svið offers a truly unique taste of Viking heritage, served with a sprinkle of salt.

name: Icelandic fish and chips (Fiskur og franskar)
short_description: Crisp spelt flour batter envelops fresh saltwater fish, creating a deliciously light crunch. Paired with golden fries, this Icelandic twist on a classic comfort dish showcases the island's rich maritime heritage.

name: Kjötsúpa
short_description: Hearty and comforting, this traditional Icelandic lamb soup combines tender meat with earthy vegetables like rutabaga and cabbage, simmered to perfection with fragrant herbs. A true taste of Iceland's rich culinary heritage.

name: Icelandic hot dog (Pylsa)
short_description: Savor the iconic Icelandic hot dog, featuring a juicy lamb sausage nestled in a warm steamed bun. Topped with fried onions, tangy ketchup, and sweet mustard, it's a beloved street food delight!

name: Rúgbrauð
short_description: Steamed in underground pits, this dense, dark brown Icelandic rye bread boasts rich flavors of molasses and honey. A staple of Nordic cuisine, it's perfect for pairing with smoked fish or butter.

name: Graflax
short_description: Originating from Scandinavian fishermen, this delightful dish features raw salmon cured with salt, sugar, and fresh dill. Its harmonious balance of flavors makes it a must-try Icelandic delicacy.

name: Pylsur
short_description: Iceland’s beloved pylsur combines ground lamb, beef, and pork with a hint of nutmeg and garlic, creating a uniquely savory hot dog experience. A must-try street food, it embodies the country’s culinary pride.

name: Vínarterta
short_description: Layered with rich prunes and a buttery dough, this traditional Icelandic treat delights with its unique texture and sweet flavor. Celebrated during holidays, vínarterta embodies a cherished cultural heritage.

name: Flatkaka
short_description: Originating from Iceland, this traditional flatbread combines earthy rye and wheat flour, resulting in a hearty, savory taste. Unleavened and pan-baked, it's perfect for pairing with rich toppings or enjoying on its own.

name: Laufabrauð
short_description: Leaf bread, a cherished Icelandic Christmas tradition since 1736, features a delicate, crispy texture with hints of buttery sweetness. Each piece is intricately patterned and lightly fried, perfect for festive feasts.

name: Oven cheese (Broddur)
short_description: Rich and creamy, this traditional Icelandic dessert combines colostrum and milk, gently baked with a hint of cinnamon and sugar. Each bite offers a warm, comforting sweetness steeped in local heritage.

name: Thorramatur
short_description: A vibrant assortment of Icelandic delicacies, Thorramatur features cured delights like hákarl (fermented shark) and hangikjöt (smoked lamb). Celebrated during Þorri, it offers a bold taste of tradition.

name: Ábrystir
short_description: Rich and creamy, this traditional Icelandic pudding showcases colostrum for a luxurious texture, reminiscent of crème brûlée. Sweetened with sugar and blended with skyr, it’s a local delicacy steeped in heritage.

name: Skyronnes
short_description: Originating from Iceland, this creamy dip combines tangy skyr with garlic, dill, parsley, and chives for a fresh, herbaceous flavor. Perfect for spreading or dipping, it embodies Icelandic culinary tradition.
